description: "Frames are visual styles you can apply to your screenshots (dots) to make them stand out. When you capture a screen, a dot is automatically created ‚Äî and you can add a frame to give it a more polished or organized look. Each frame style helps you adapt the appearance of your dot depending on the context, whether it‚Äôs for feedback, presentation, or team review."

## üìù How to use Frames

üßæ Make sure you have a dot ready that you want to style.

üîÑ Click the ‚ÄúRotate Frame‚Äù button in the toolbar.

üîç Each click cycles through the available frame styles.

üìçKeep rotating until you find the frame that best fits your dot and context.

üíæ Once you have the desired frame, your dot is ready to share, present, or review.

::div{class="flex w-full justify-center max-w-6xl mx-auto h-130 py-4"}
:video{src="/frame.mp4" class="rounded-md object-cover w-full h-full" controls autoplay muted loop}
::


### üí°Tips

* Use frames to visually differentiate dots for presentations, feedback, or reviews.

* Stick to consistent frame styles within the same project for a clean and professional look.

* Combine frames with annotations, highlights, or stickers to make key information stand out.
